```{block starwars-prompt}
Consider the `starwars` dataset. Use `transmute()` to turn convert `height` into
inches and `mass` into pounds, keeping only those columns.
```

```{r starwars-setup, include=FALSE}
library(dplyr)
```

```{r starwars, exercise = TRUE}

```

```{r starwars-solution}
starwars %>%
  transmute(height = height / 2.54, mass = mass * 2.205)
```

```{r starwars-check}
grade_this_table(check_column_order = TRUE)
```

```{r starwars-wrong-mutate}
# "names" problem (too many)
starwars %>%
  mutate(height = height / 2.54, mass = mass * 2.205)
```

```{r starwars-wrong-columns}
# "names" problem (wrong order)
starwars %>%
  transmute(mass = mass * 2.205, height = height / 2.54)
```

```{r starwars-wrong-class}
# "class" problem
starwars %>%
  transmute(mass = as.integer(mass * 2.205), height = as.integer(height / 2.54))
```

```{r starwars-wrong-values}
# "values" problem
starwars %>%
  transmute(height = height, mass = mass)
```
